criteria: Knowledge of Safe Food Handling Practices
Application of Safe Food Handling in Meal/Snack Preparation
descriptions: Demonstrates no understanding of safe food handling practices.
Demonstrates minimal understanding of safe food handling practices; struggles to identify basic principles.
Demonstrates a limited understanding of safe food handling practices; identifies some basic principles but with inaccuracies.
Demonstrates a satisfactory understanding of safe food handling practices; correctly identifies most principles.
Demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of safe food handling practices; accurately identifies and explains principles.
Demonstrates an exceptional understanding of safe food handling practices; thoroughly and accurately explains principles, going beyond basic requirements.
Does not apply any safe food handling practices when describing meal/snack preparation.
Applies safe food handling practices inconsistently and incorrectly when describing meal/snack preparation.
Applies some safe food handling practices correctly when describing meal/snack preparation, but with noticeable gaps.
Applies most safe food handling practices correctly and consistently when describing meal/snack preparation.
Applies safe food handling practices accurately and consistently when describing meal/snack preparation, with clear explanations.
Applies safe food handling practices expertly and comprehensively when describing meal/snack preparation, providing detailed and insightful explanations.
Shows no awareness of cross-contamination or how to prevent it.
Shows a limited awareness of cross-contamination and struggles to explain prevention methods.
Explains cross-contamination with some inaccuracies and identifies a few basic prevention methods.
Explains cross-contamination accurately and identifies common prevention methods.
Explains cross-contamination thoroughly and provides detailed prevention methods.
Explains cross-contamination with exceptional detail and demonstrates advanced prevention strategies.
